title: The 5 : 00 News : Pittsboro Death , Displaced Chapel Hill Residents , and Bill Belichick
body_text:
97.9 The Hill’s Aaron Keck guest-hosts “News On The Hill” for Thursday, August 21, and shares the latest local news.
In today’s news: the Chatham County Sheriff’s Office conducts a death investigation in Pittsboro; an advocacy group sounds the alarm on behalf of Chapel Hill residents who are still displaced from their homes after Tropical Depression Chantal; the Uproar Festival of Public Art nears its conclusion; Chatham County gets a credit-rating upgrade; UNC men’s and women’s soccer prepare for evening matches; Bill Belichick shares what he enjoys most about coaching football in college; Tar Heel women’s basketball adds another international transfer; and the ACC preseason rankings are out for cross country.
97.9 The Hill WCHL and Chapelboro.com are your headquarters for local news in Chapel Hill-Carrboro. Every weekday afternoon, 97.9 The Hill’s Andrew Stuckey recaps the day’s news, from local government to business developments to UNC sports, and everything in-between. Hear compelling stories, breaking news, and more. Find all of Andrew’s 5:00 News Reports by clicking here.
